Name: Kneeling king
Description: This fragment of relief in wood in ajour technique depicts a king kneeling on a naos, offering an udjat-eye and a nefer-sign on a neb-basket. He is protected by the outstretched wings of a standing goddess. She is standing on a pedestal decorated with neb-baskets, ankh-signs and was-sceptres. The relief was originally inlaid and presumably comes from a piece of furniture or a shrine.
